item.title: Unlit caravan not moved since July, 30th November
item.description:
There is a caravan parked opposite Reeves Field in Charlton Park Drive. It is unlit and a danger at night as that section of road is very dark. I has not moved since July and the number plate that was on it has been removed.
Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by OpenStreetMap): 30, King William Drive, Charlton Kings, Cheltenham

item.title: Unable to pass along pavement safely, 30th November
item.description:
The hedge alongside 20 Cowslip Meadow is now dangerously overhanging the pavement by at least 2.5 feet. I cannot get a pushchair down the pavement safely. This has been reported before but was deemed safe! A lady on her mobility scooter had to reverse back as she could not negotiate it. How can this be deemed safe.

Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by OpenStreetMap): Keepers Mill, Woodmancote, Tewkesbury
Report on FixMyStreet
item.category: Other damage to pavement i.e. cobbles, raised mound/surface

item.title: Brockworth Bridleway 60 - path muddy beyond resurfacing, 30th November
item.description:
The recent repair works to get rid of the muddy section of the Brockworth bridleway 60 has improved the path way, and resolved much of the problems, however, muddy sections, continue further along the path, it requested that you extend the works at the very least to the junction with the unadopted pathway leading to Bamel Way on the Gloucester business Park. Without this work, the path is still inconvenient to users of route during all seasons of the year. Given its urban location of this route, there is a need to take greater consideration of the needs of all users, including those who might try to use the route using motorised scooters and the like. In determining your prioritisation of this, I would draw your attention to the fact that this is a critical piece of infrastructure to provide access to community services based on the business Park due to your inability to adopt a roots via golf course road to the business Park from the Spinners Road ecetera development at the rear of Invista

Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by OpenStreetMap): Spinners Road, Brockworth, Tewkesbury
Report on FixMyStreet

item.title: A pothole in road problem, 30th November
item.description:
Customer's 3 year old daughter has fallen off her balance bike as she was crossing the road. Her daughters went to A&E and her tooth has gone through her lip and she is very shaken up. Customer has mentioned claiming but has stressed that she does not want this happening again as this is dangerous and her daughter was lucky as it could of been worse.
Report on FixMyStreet

item.title: There is a disabled parking bay out of the front out our house that we have just completed on. We have been made aware that this was out here for the previous occupier who has now passed away., 30th November
item.description:
1. Please can this disabled parking bay be removed? 2. Please can we place our skip here on 5th December otherwise we will have to put our skip in front of another house which we do not feel is fair to our neighbours when there is space in front of our house (we just don’t want to put it on top of the disabled markings without confirmation that this is ok to do so). Thank you

Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by OpenStreetMap): Brandon Place, Naunton, Cheltenham
Report on FixMyStreet

item.title: Loose/rattling cover/ironwork problem, 30th November
item.description:
Email rcvd 29.11.23 - Good Afternoon, I would like to report an issue with the drainage from our property. I have contacted Severn Trent who sent me to Cheltenham Borough Council who have told me it is Gloucestershire Highways domaine. The rainwater gulley at the front of our property fills up very quickly under usual heavy rain and is slow to drain away. I have attached a photo and video of the drains after just 1 hour of extreme heavy rain in the storm we had in October. The drain backed up so badly that the driveway access to our front door was completely flooded with 2-3 inches of water at the deepest points. I had to carry my two sons over it so their school shoes didn't get flooded. Once the rain stopped completely it took 2 hours to slowly runaway (Our neighbours did not have an issue like this). This has been an issue since we first moved to the property and seems to be worsening. Earlier this year and we have since had gravel and channel drains installed to the front and side of our property to help the drainage issue, but it has made little difference as the issue is that our gulley flow can't handle the volume of water from the downpipe coming off the roof. I am very concerned that this level of flooding happened after just one hour of heavy rain, I dread to think what a day of it would be like! I called a local drainage company out who have confirmed our property and drains are well maintained and clear from debris. They suggested that slow drainage would be the cause of the storm drain assets beyond our property. We have located 2 manholes at the front of neighbouring properties which we believe are likely serve our property for storm drainage. Both looked very old in the way they were built with our drainage company explaining there is likely no utility maps of them and that we would need to ask the Council for CCTV, or a dye test carried out to work out where our water goes and what issues there is along the line (cont...see attached)
Report on FixMyStreet

item.title: Stop sign too low., 30th November
item.description:
This stop sign, where Back Lane joins the North Street, Greet Road, Gretton Road junction is, in my opinion, fixed too low on the lamppost. I am 6 ft 1inch high and every time I walk this way I have to be really careful not to crack my head on the sign. It should be the work of moments for one of you engineers to move it up by 12 inches.

Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by OpenStreetMap): Back Lane, Winchcombe, Winchcombe
Report on FixMyStreet

item.title: Raised pavement in several places due to roots from tree, 29th November
item.description:
I have already reported this and was advised the repair was done. I expected the tarmac to be redone but nothing has been done. On the corner of Pilley lane by the sign, the pavement is raised which is a tripping hazard. Also this continues past the road sign and into Pilley Lane.
Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by OpenStreetMap): 1, Pilley Lane, Leckhampton, Cheltenham
Report on FixMyStreet
